messages.subject: the 30's
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/14/02 11:25:35 PM, ecsamhill@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/14/02 11:25:35 PM, ecsamhill@... writes:

<< I think the new American Girls series of books, featuring "Kit", is set
in the Thirties. Do you think they would be too simplistic and cutesy
for Holly? >>

No! I think it would be great.
I've read her Josefina Montoya books, because it's local to us (thirty five
miles north of here is where they set it).

I'll get one of those and see what she thinks. Thanks!

<< Have you done Paper Moon?>>

Yes. She LOVES that. And she loves that she got a Simpsons scene entirely,
every nuance, because of knowing that movie well.

<<Did you know that there was a campaign in California to get everyone to
read The Grapes of Wrath on the same day this year? You two visited CA,
but you may have missed the day... <g>>>

That's interesting!
I used to love that book when I was young and angstful.

Sandra
